actionPlugin.description: Changes the outcome field of an application.
actionPlugin.name: Change Outcome

actionPlugin.description: Changes the Status of an application
actionPlugin.name: Change Status

actionPlugin.description: All it does is print a message to the console. That's it.
actionPlugin.name: Console Logger

actionPlugin.description: Adds a record to verification table
actionPlugin.name: Create Verification

actionPlugin.description: Checks all the uploaded files associated with an application, and deletes any that are not part of an application_response
actionPlugin.name: Clean up application files

actionPlugin.description: Generates a PDF document from a Carbone template
actionPlugin.name: Generate Document

actionPlugin.description: Generates review_assignment records for current application
actionPlugin.name: Generate Review Assignment Records

actionPlugin.description: Generates serial numbers or arbitrary text strings (e.g. for application name) using a specified pattern, and updates a database record if requested
actionPlugin.name: Generate Text String

actionPlugin.description: Grants permission to user/org, creates permission join from user/org to permission name. If org not provided, the permission will be granted to the user only.
actionPlugin.name: Grant Permissions

actionPlugin.description: Increments (or creates) the application Stage, if possible.
actionPlugin.name: Increment Stage

actionPlugin.description: Links a user to an organisation
actionPlugin.name: Add User to Organisation

actionPlugin.description: Inserts or updates a record in database, e.g. User, Org
actionPlugin.name: Modify Record

actionPlugin.description: Creates a notification and send an email
actionPlugin.name: Send Email

actionPlugin.description: Trims duplicated application or review responses if nothing has changed
actionPlugin.name: Trim duplicate reponses

actionPlugin.description: Update status of Review Assignment records when one is Assigned
actionPlugin.name: Update Review Assignment statuses

actionPlugin.description: Updates status of associated reviews when application re-submitted
actionPlugin.name: Update Review Statuses

actionPlugin.description: Updates review response records to be visible to Applicant based on recommendations of last level review
actionPlugin.name: Update Applicant's Review Visibility

actionPlugin.description: Revokes existing permission(s) from user/org -- only sets existing permissions to inactive, doesn't actually delete records
actionPlugin.name: Revoke Permissions

actionPlugin.description: Adds a record to action_schedule table to schedule an action for some time in the future
actionPlugin.name: Create Scheduled Action

children: query getOrgUsers($id:Int!) { userOrganisations(filter: {organisationId: {equalTo: $id}}) { nodes { user { id, firstName, lastName }}}}
query getUsersOrgs($id: Int!) {  userOrganisations(filter: {userId: {equalTo: $id}}) { nodes { organisation { name, id }}}}

templateAction.description: **CORE-ACTION** Change application outcome when last level and last stage - usually a final decision - submits a review as CONFORM or NON_CONFORM. Outcome will be APPROVED or REJECTED accordingly

templateAction.description: **CORE-ACTION** Change application outcome when last level and last stage - usually a final decision - submits a review as CONFORM or NON_CONFORM. Outcome will be APPROVED or REJECTED accordingly

message.value:
Testing parallel actions -- This message is Asynchronous. 
Even though it is last in the Actions list, it'll probably appear first.

templateAction.description: **CORE-ACTION** Generate serial for application when created
**CORE-ACTION** Generate name for application wen created
**CORE-ACTION** Increment to first stage when application is created
**CORE-ACTION** Change application status from CHANGES REQUIRED to DRAFT when the applicant restarts one application with  to do updates (as requested in review).

**CORE-ACTION** Change review status to DRAFT when the reviewer clicks to re-review a previous review made which has new status as PENDING or CHANGES REQUESTED. Previous status depends if is coming from lower level or applicant (PENDING) or if is coming back from upper level reviewer (CHANGES REQUESTED)
**CORE-ACTION** Change review status to DRAFT when the reviewer clicks to start one assignment (and not locked) new review
**CORE-ACTION** Change review status to LOCKED when the reviewer clicks to start one assignment with has flag isLocked as true
**CORE-ACTION** Change application status from DRAFT to SUBMITTED when the applicant submits the application
**CORE-ACTION** Remove duplicated and unchanged responses when application is re-submitted by the applicant.
**CORE-ACTION** Generate level 1 review assignments in current stage after application is submitted by the applicant
**CORE-ACTION** Update reviews status with review assignment linked to changed responses by applicant when application is resubmitted.
**CORE-ACTION** Garbage collector for files uploaded and removed by the applicant
**CORE-ACTION** Change review status to SUBMITTED when the reviewer submits
**CORE-ACTION** Remove duplicated and unchanged responses or ones without a decision made when review is re-submitted by the reviewer.
**CORE-ACTION** Update other review status to PENDING or CHANGES REQUESTED after one review is submitted to another reviewer in the chain of review-levels
**CORE-ACTION** Increment stage of application when last level reviewer submits review with decision of CONFORM or NON_CONFORM
**CORE-ACTION** Generate next level (in current stage) of review assignments after one reviewer submits a review to next level - when applicable
**CORE-ACTION** Allow visibility to review responses (always level 1) on the current stage that were DECLINED to show to applicant after review is submitted with decision of LIST_OF_QUESTIONS
**CORE-ACTION** Change application status to CHANGES_REQUIRED once a last level reviewer submits with decision of LIST_OF_QUESTIONS
**CORE-ACTION** Change application outcome when last level and last stage - usually a final decision - submits a review as CONFORM or NON_CONFORM. Outcome will be APPROVED or REJECTED accordingly
Example: console log with application serial and template code

children: Application %1 was submitted of template code %2

templateAction.description: Example: action to modify record in database using fields from application when outcome is change to APPROVED
Example: action to connect user to organisation when application outcome is APPROVED
Example: action to grant permissions to user when logged in with organisation joined when application outcome is APPROVED
Change outcome to REJECT in case of NON_CONFORM decision in first stage of Screening. The next stage Assessment can also change the outcome to APPROVED/REJECTED
Send notification about Demo application to user's email when outcome is APPROVED

children:
# Your company licence has been registered.

Hi %1 %2, 

Your application %3 to register a licence to apply for Product registrations for company ‘%4’ has been approved. 

Log into your mFlow account to view the changes. 

Many thanks, 

{Regulatory Authority}

templateAction.description: Send notification about Demo application to user's email when the outcome is REJECTED

children:
# Your application has been rejected
 
%1 application was rejected during stage of %2.
The outline reason for rejection is:
    "%3"

To see more information on mFlow visit %4/application/%5

Many thanks,

%6
Changes have been made to your application %1

templateAction.description: Send notification about Demo application to user's email when reviewer has submitted a List of Questions

children:
# A List of Questions have been submitted
 
Application %1 needs your attention now. 

%2

To see and make changes to your application on mFlow visit: %3/application/%4

Many thanks,

%5

The outline reason for changes required is:

    "%2"
Changes have been made to your application %1

Create application name
Create verification so that user can confirm their identity via email link

children:
## Verification successful

[Click here](/application/%1/id/Page1/?sessionId=%2) to change your password

templateAction.description: Send verification email

children:
Hi %1,

someone with your username (%2) requested to reset your password. If this wasn't you, or this was unintentional, please disregard this email.

In order to reset your password, please click (or copy-paste) the following link:

%3/verify?uid=%4

templateAction.description: Once verified, change password hash in database
We're done
Increments stage so user can change password
Set to "Changes Request" so can be edited again, this time with password field active
